PAS.content: must be able to reject the gift, vomir ce qui t’appelle à dire viens, forget in order to reject the poison, to not guard the gift
PAS.linkedContent: must be able to reject the gift, vomir ce qui t’appelle à dire viens, forget in order to reject the poison, to not guard the gift

F.content: introj. as idealization, incorp. refuses metaphor of substitutive supplement, refuses introj.; incorp. fantasy takes introj.'s oral metaphor literally: vomits into inside, into pocket of cyst
F.linkedContent: introj. as idealization, incorp. refuses metaphor of substitutive supplement, refuses introj.; incorp. fantasy takes introj.'s oral metaphor literally: vomits into inside, into pocket of cyst

OTO.content: for Nietzsche, importance of vomit (Ekel), learning to vomit, so as to form one’s taste, one’s disgust; Derrida refers to Hamacher’s Pleroma, Hegel and Ekel
OTO.linkedContent: for Nietzsche, importance of vomit (Ekel), learning to vomit, so as to form one’s taste, one’s disgust; Derrida refers to Hamacher’s Pleroma, Hegel and Ekel

REST.content: play w/ se rendre, render onto, give back, surrender, give oneself back, vomit
REST.linkedContent: play w/ se rendre, render onto, give back, surrender, give oneself back, vomit

REST.content: don’t have to render anything: just bet on the trap like others swear (jurent) on a Bible > il y aura eu à parier, ça donne à rendre, a remmettre [there will be something to bet, it gives…] ——if faudrait “rendre” encore, donc, en se séparant, et même en laissant tomber [even in letting the matter drop, we’d render (something?)]
REST.linkedContent: don’t have to render anything: just bet on the trap like others swear (jurent) on a Bible > il y aura eu à parier, ça donne à rendre, a remmettre [there will be something to bet, it gives…] ——if faudrait “rendre” encore, donc, en se séparant, et même en laissant tomber [even in letting the matter drop, we’d render (something?)]

C.content: disseminal spurt (projet) of semen [120 Days…] does not emerge (débouche) into the other’s mouth (bouche) before the turd has been incorporated by the mouth, his own: embouchure of the remainder, vomit in economimesis
C.linkedContent: disseminal spurt (projet) of semen [120 Days…] does not emerge (débouche) into the other’s mouth (bouche) before the turd has been incorporated by the mouth, his own: embouchure of the remainder, vomit in economimesis

E.content: Kant’s exemplorality, exemplary orality, the mouth—os as absolute of every analogon: mouth is the measure of taste, of good art, it’s also the measure of bad taste (consumptive taste): one expressive (emissive) the other vomitive (emitic) > 2 means of entering/leaving the mouth
E.linkedContent: Kant’s exemplorality, exemplary orality, the mouth—os as absolute of every analogon: mouth is the measure of taste, of good art, it’s also the measure of bad taste (consumptive taste): one expressive (emissive) the other vomitive (emitic) > 2 means of entering/leaving the mouth

E.content: if pure taste demands non-consumption, wouldn’t disgust (rejection) be origin of pure taste?
E.linkedContent: if pure taste demands non-consumption, wouldn’t disgust (rejection) be origin of pure taste?

E.content: logo-phonocentric system doesn’t exclude a negative, negative is its business, it’s work, it excludes what can’t be digested, represented, eaten, irreducible heterogeneity: vomit
E.linkedContent: logo-phonocentric system doesn’t exclude a negative, negative is its business, it’s work, it excludes what can’t be digested, represented, eaten, irreducible heterogeneity: vomit

E.content: tautologically, vomit never lets itself be swallowed > thus causes itself to be vomited
E.linkedContent: tautologically, vomit never lets itself be swallowed > thus causes itself to be vomited

E.content: since, for Kant, the sensibility of the mouth also produces its ideality, vomit, for Derrida, will work on both levels as well
E.linkedContent: since, for Kant, the sensibility of the mouth also produces its ideality, vomit, for Derrida, will work on both levels as well

E.content: Derrida interested in vomit in relation to disgust, not vomiting (which can still be reappropriated as auto-affective)
E.linkedContent: Derrida interested in vomit in relation to disgust, not vomiting (which can still be reappropriated as auto-affective)

E.content: for Kant, that which is disgusting more unassimilable than evil, the ugly, the horrible (all of which can be made beautiful)
E.linkedContent: for Kant, that which is disgusting more unassimilable than evil, the ugly, the horrible (all of which can be made beautiful)

E.content: the ultimately disgusting is unrepresentable, l’exclu absolu, if one could name or represent it, it could enter auto-affective circle of master/reappropriation > must be insensible too (unnameable, un-intelligible), the absolute other of the system [Derrida compares this structure to that of the colossal]
E.linkedContent: the ultimately disgusting is unrepresentable, l’exclu absolu, if one could name or represent it, it could enter auto-affective circle of master/reappropriation > must be insensible too (unnameable, un-intelligible), the absolute other of the system [Derrida compares this structure to that of the colossal]

E.content: unrepresentable vomit violates our enjoyment, abolishes representative distance, prevents mourning, forces one to consume w/out chance of idealization
E.linkedContent: unrepresentable vomit violates our enjoyment, abolishes representative distance, prevents mourning, forces one to consume w/out chance of idealization

E.content: unrepresentable vomit gives too much enjoyment, suspends the suspension of non-consummation (which accompanies pleasure bound up w/ representation): it burns up all work as mourning work
E.linkedContent: unrepresentable vomit gives too much enjoyment, suspends the suspension of non-consummation (which accompanies pleasure bound up w/ representation): it burns up all work as mourning work

E.content: if mourning always consists in biting off the bit (le mors), a remainder, a corpse, the disgusting can only be vomited
E.linkedContent: if mourning always consists in biting off the bit (le mors), a remainder, a corpse, the disgusting can only be vomited

E.content: to say that the other of the system of taste is distaste (disgust) is tautological, yes > Derrida wonders whether the tautological structure (that of logos as self-same-identity) is the very form of what the exclusion (of disgust) serves to construct
E.linkedContent: to say that the other of the system of taste is distaste (disgust) is tautological, yes > Derrida wonders whether the tautological structure (that of logos as self-same-identity) is the very form of what the exclusion (of disgust) serves to construct

E.content: in the third passage of Zarathustra, Nietzsche ponders what can make one desire to vomit
E.linkedContent: in the third passage of Zarathustra, Nietzsche ponders what can make one desire to vomit

E.content: Kant: smell is, in a sense, taste at a distance, it is less sociable, more primed for disgust
E.linkedContent: Kant: smell is, in a sense, taste at a distance, it is less sociable, more primed for disgust

E.content: what is absolutely foreclosed from Kant’s system is not vomit but possibility of vicariousness of vomit, of its replacement by anything else: something that would undo the hierarchizing authority of logocentric analogy—its power of identification > i.e. the “in the place of,” replacement that has no proper place, no return: [the] in place of prosthesis ——w/in logocentric system (w/in the name), one simply can’t name what’s outside it, to say it would be to eat it—or, what is no longer absolutely different—to vomit it
E.linkedContent: what is absolutely foreclosed from Kant’s system is not vomit but possibility of vicariousness of vomit, of its replacement by anything else: something that would undo the hierarchizing authority of logocentric analogy—its power of identification > i.e. the “in the place of,” replacement that has no proper place, no return: [the] in place of prosthesis ——w/in logocentric system (w/in the name), one simply can’t name what’s outside it, to say it would be to eat it—or, what is no longer absolutely different—to vomit it

E.content: question “what is?”: offers a paregoric parergon, constructs framework to capture energy of unassimilable, it softens, remedies, w/ speech, consoles, exhorts w/ the word
E.linkedContent: question “what is?”: offers a paregoric parergon, constructs framework to capture energy of unassimilable, it softens, remedies, w/ speech, consoles, exhorts w/ the word

E.content: vomit, the word, arrests the vicariousness of disgust, and thus is still an elixir for philosophy
E.linkedContent: vomit, the word, arrests the vicariousness of disgust, and thus is still an elixir for philosophy

CIN.content: the cinder like burning semen (semence brûlante), lava destined nowhere, when you take word into your mouth, to breathe
CIN.linkedContent: the cinder like burning semen (semence brûlante), lava destined nowhere, when you take word into your mouth, to breathe
